creator: rstubbe@sit.nl
text:
I am using SSI pages with multiple "include virtual" commands.  on all pages 
where this occurs the first "include virtual" gets executed, the second and 
following "include virtual" commands don't get executed, but the source is 
included in the html code.

sample of the used "include virtual commands".


<!--#include virtual="/prog/price.php?model=HD1100SK" -->
<!--#include virtual="/prog/avail.php?model=HD1100SK" -->

creator: rederpj@remulak.net
text:
Are all the problematic "include virtual" commands calls to php? Do *any* of
your "include virtual" commands work?

I have tried a variety of "include virtual" commands with the current version of
the code (Apache/2.1.0-dev) and cannot duplicate this problem. The only obvious
difference is that I don't have PHP installed, but I did run several cgi scripts
with arguments.

If you could manually check that the PHP code is returning valid content it
would be very helpful. Then try this with the latest version of Apache code and
let me know if you still have trouble.

Thanks.

creator: rstubbe@sit.nl
text:
I am using ther latest released versioe, i.e. 2.0.43.
I use 2 different PHP scripts, which are called on different pages, in 
different order.  Only the first PHP script is executed, all remaining PHP 
scripts the source is added to the HTML source, but is not executed.  The pages 
work fine under 1.3.27.
When I use XBitHack, the same happens, i.e. the first virtual included PHP 
scripts gets executed, all other virtual included PHP scripts the source code 
in inserted into the HTML code.
I have included on one page two perl scripts, but that seems to work correct.
When I put the script source in the pages, and rename the page from shtml to 
php it all execute correctly.
